description: Creates or updates the specified rule.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: EventBridge rules can be configured to trigger signals that facilitate command and control communication, masking malicious traffic as legitimate event triggers.
Creating or updating EventBridge rules can schedule tasks or jobs that perform malicious activities without user intervention.
By manipulating EventBridge rules, attackers can potentially alter the flow of logs and events to hide their activities.
By updating EventBridge rules, attackers can disable or modify security tools and alerts, impairing defenses and ensuring continued access.

incidents.description: Cloud Security Stories: From Risky Permissions to Ransomware Execution

securityImplications: Attackers might use PutRule in AWS EventBridge to create unauthorized event rules, potentially automating malicious actions to gain persistence or triggering unwarranted responses within the environment.
